== Who I am ==
I work at Canonical and am currently working on developing mechanisms for OEMs and carriers to customize Ubuntu Touch images. That is the purpose of me applying for this package.

== My Ubuntu story ==
I've been using Ubuntu for a few years now and now I get paid to work on it!

=== My involvement ===
=== Examples of my work / Things I'm proud of ===

Since I became a MOTU I've done a few uploads:

* account-plugin-fitbit
* mousetweaks
* workrave

And two new debian packages (one is not yet synchronized to Ubuntu):
 
* dateutils
* unyaffs

I also have lots of sponsored stuff, mainly desktop packages, check out my <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MattFischer|main wiki page]]</nowiki> for an updated list.

=== Areas of work ===
I am an Ubuntu Member and MOTU. I've also been active as a member of the Bug Squad and during my day job work on Ubuntu Touch. Right now I am focused on the ubuntu-touch-customization-hooks package. That package is specific to Ubuntu Touch as it allows us to create customization tarballs for OEMs and carriers. These tarballs contain things like custom wallpapers, sample pictures, ringtones, etc. This package is not used by the desktop or server and probably never will be.

=== Things I could do better ===

== Plans for the future ==
=== General ===
Keep doing MOTU work and get more packages into Debian and Ubuntu. Update packages that I like to use (like workrave). Learn more about the core dev processes and about debian processes too.

=== What I like least in Ubuntu ===
I'd like Ubuntu to provide more documentation to developers, specifically for the Ubuntu Touch project. I've been bugging people on IRC and writing (or encouraging writing) blog posts to spread developer knowledge.
